alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 1:22PM MDT until June 24 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River At La Junta affecting Otero County. Arkansas River Near Nepesta affecting Pueblo County. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Nepesta and La Junta... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Arkansas River Near Nepesta. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Minor Flood. Agricultural lands near Nepesta are under threat of flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM MDT Friday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM MDT Friday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 14.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 16.0 feet Sunday morning. It will fall to 15.8 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then rise to 16.1 feet Tuesday evening. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 05/21/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening around 730 PM MDT.
